comments.html:
> Betteridge's Law of Headlines, right?

Pretty much so ;)

> And what about peering the EVPN with the SDWAN?

Inter-AS option A (per-VRF BGP peering over VLAN trunk) always works. It's not exactly elegant though.

> Plenty of vendors with DC and WAN offering but none with a sensible white paper on peering DC and WAN.

There must a reason for that 🤪
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
Betteridge's Law of Headlines, right?

And what about peering the EVPN with the SDWAN? Vendors have tried it but I don't really know a single successful implementation. And DIY? Good luck getting the control plane and data plane integrated and talking, and that doesn't even cover policy management.

Plenty of vendors with DC and WAN offering (VMWare, Arista, Cisco, Juniper) but none with a sensible white paper on peering DC and WAN.
